meanings.definition: Capable of being administered or managed
meanings.sent1: The instructions were clear and administrable for the new employees.
meanings.sent2: The system was designed to be administrable by users of all skill levels.
meanings.sent3: It was a relief to find an administrable solution to the complex problem.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor made her an administrable leader in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The administrable nature of the project made it easy to coordinate with the team.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being administered or managed
meanings.sent1: The medication was administrable in small doses for children.
meanings.sent2: The new software proved to be administrable for the company's needs.
meanings.sent3: The administrable size of the team made collaboration efficient.
meanings.sent4: His flexible schedule was administrable for handling unexpected tasks.
meanings.sent5: The administrable budget allowed for necessary upgrades without overspending.
